revised_title: Advancements in Freeze-Etching Technique for Electron Microscopy in Biology
tldr: The article discusses recent progress in the freeze-etching technique for electron microscopy in biology. It explores improvements in vitrification, fracture processes, and the use of antifreeze agents and high-pressure freezing to overcome limitations and extend the method's range to molecular dimensions. The double-replica method is introduced to evaluate artifacts and provide insight into membrane splitting.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology and Microscopy
